choices.A: The switchport is on the default VLAN.
choices.B: The BDPU guard is enabled on the switch.

discussion.content: DCHP? I think they meant DHCP... what do I know?

questions.question_text: A network technician installed a new workstation in an empty office for a new employee. The workstation will not connect to the network resources. The NIC and switch connection LED are both green, and the workstation reports an IP address of 169.254.10.1. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the issue?

A network technician directly connected two laptops together via 802.11 protocol. Under which of the following network topologies are the laptops operating?
(Choose two.)

discussion.content: Connected via Wireless protocol. Should be Ad Hoc and point-point

comments.content: Wireless. I dont think Bus Topology is for Wireless
there are multiple devices...two laptops connected on a BUS topology

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
no bus since there is not multiple devices. Ad-hoc and point to point describes this question

Selected Answer: BC
I believe this is suppose to be Ad Hoc and point to point.

From this article I think that the correct answer is b and c 

https://omnisecu.com/basic-networking/ad-hoc-wireless-topology.php

questions.question_text:
A network analyst is troubleshooting a connectivity issue between switch A and switch B. The switches are configured with the following subnets:
//IMG//

Clients in VLANs 10 and 16 can communicate between switch A and switch B, but clients in VLAN 13 can communicate only with other clients on the same switch.
Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?

discussion.content: VLAN=802.1Q that is what i got out of it.

choices.A: Configure the local machines to get an IP address from the ISP automatically.
choices.B: Configure each host with a static IP address within the 173.28.199.0 block.
choices.D: Configure each host to use its link local addresses for network discovery.
choices.C: Configure the router's static IP and create a NAT for the local network address of 10.10.10.0/24.

questions.question_text: A network technician is setting up a newly installed Internet connection at a SOHO that will support up to ten devices on the network. The company is required to provide its own router to connect to the Internet. The ISP has assigned an IP address of 173.28.199.67/32 to the office. Which of the following does the network technician need to perform to ensure all devices on the network can access the Internet?

discussion.content: where did that Class A address even come from?

comments.content: I think thats the company routers IP address

discussion.content: I believe the answer is correct (c), but I saw on one of the Q&A online practice question it set as router (A), which is really impossible.

questions.question_text: A network technician is troubleshooting a DOCSIS network. Which of the following devices marks the termination of the ISP's network and the start of the customer's network?
